post.body: Are we working? ;) Good to see you on Twitter, Chip.
I was able to catch a nap during the 1 hour drive to my Mom's house for Christmas #3. My wife did the driving thankfully.
Shrimp, lobster, filet mignon and scallops at Benihana's could be your new tradition.
I'll take my Flip and see if it comes out. It's a candlelight service and we sit about 2/3 back.
I wasn't looking for anything in particular, the thought just crossed my mind to look for you while I was in Mardel.
I've been using TweetDeck and the web exclusively. Used to use Twhirl, but it's been a while. http://www.twhirl.org/
I was moving fast and didn't ask clerk, and only looked in one section of the store. Was there to get a Bible.
Reward for the night, sharing a glass of Piper Sonoma Select Cuvee with my lovely wife. G'night.
RT @VintageTexas: Posted article: Sparkling Wine: A Well Deserved Texas Treat! - Part 1; http://vintagetexas.com/blog/?p=355
Does it mean you're getting old when you're glad you got socks for Christmas?
First Christmas complete. Getting ready to head to sister-in-law's for second Christmas.
Here is the video of the Glen Bills "Oh Holy Night" solo from our church last night. The video doesn't do it justice. http://snipr.com/93y6b
I'll leave you with some Christmas reflections from @swoodruff http://is.gd/dlLF
What's your Christmas tradition? My wife and I will share a glass of port by the fire when we return from Christmas Eve services.
We have tenor at our church who sings a goosebump inducing solo of "Oh Holy Night." I think half the crowd is there to hear him sing.
Gifts wrapped. Time to relax a little bit before heading to Christmas Eve services at our church.
One present wrapped in 30 minutes. Time to close Tweet Deck.
Maybe it's my magnetic personality, but I do wonder why some people follow me.
Check out @starbucker for his version of The Tweet Before Christmas
Luther Vandross does an excellent version of Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas.
